DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Clinically Significant Indicator Immunodeficiency and Immunosuppression Or Opportunistic Infection Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study that are related to clinically significant immunosuppression or immunodeficiency disorders, or infections caused by organisms that are capable of causing disease in immunocompromised patients.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Clinically Significant Indicator Immune System and Related Disorders Or Opportunistic Infection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Specifies whether a finding or condition is clinically significant based on judgment._A group of non-neoplastic and neoplastic disorders resulting from the deregulation and/or deficiency of immune system functions. It includes autoimmune disorders (e.g., lupus erythematosus, dermatomyositis, rheumatoid arthritis), congenital and acquired immunodeficiency syndromes including the acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS), and neoplasms (e.g., lymphomas and malignancies secondary to transplantation)._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Clinically Significant Indicator Immune System and Related Disorders Or Opportunistic Infection
Property.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether a finding or condition is clinically significant based on judgment.:A group of non-neoplastic and neoplastic disorders resulting from the deregulation and/or deficiency of immune system functions. It includes autoimmune disorders (e.g., lupus erythematosus, dermatomyositis, rheumatoid arthritis), congenital and acquired immunodeficiency syndromes including the acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS), and neoplasms (e.g., lymphomas and malignancies secondary to transplantation).:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression.

Concepts.definition: Specifies whether a finding or condition is clinically significant based on judgment.

A group of non-neoplastic and neoplastic disorders resulting from the deregulation and/or deficiency of immune system functions. It includes autoimmune disorders (e.g., lupus erythematosus, dermatomyositis, rheumatoid arthritis), congenital and acquired immunodeficiency syndromes including the acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS), and neoplasms (e.g., lymphomas and malignancies secondary to transplantation).

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Infection caused by an organism that is capable of causing disease in immunocompromised patients only (e.g. HIV-positive or transplanted patients).--2004

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have evidence of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of clinically significant immunosuppression such as primary immunodeficiency state such as Severe Combined Immunodeficiency Disease or concurrent opportunistic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of clinically significant immunosuppression such as: primary immunodeficiency state such as Severe Combined Immunodeficiency Disease, or is receiving systemic immunosuppressive therapy including prednisone doses greater than 10 mg/day or equivalent to tacrolimus, everolimus, sirolimus, mycophenolate mofetil, etanercept, infliximab, etc?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of clinically significant immunosuppression such as: primary immunodeficiency state such as Severe Combined Immunodeficiency Disease, concurrent opportunistic infection, or is receiving systemic immunosuppressive therapy (greater than 2 weeks) including oral steroid doses greater than 10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent within 2 months prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of clinically significant immunosuppression such as: primary immunodeficiency state such as Severe Combined Immunodeficiency Disease, or is receiving systemic immunosuppressive therapy including prednisone doses greater than 10 mg/day or equivalent to tacrolimus, everolimus, sirolimus, mycophenolate mofetil, etanercept, infliximab, etc or recipients of solid organ, bone marrow or stem cell transplants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of clinically significant immunosuppression (e.g. organ transplant patients)?
